name: misp
label: MISP
description: MISP connector allows to create MISP event, delete MISP event, add and delete attributes (IOCs), add and delete tags, into existing MISP event

fields.title: Server Name
fields.description: Hostname or IP address of the MISP server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: hostname

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: API key that is configured for your account for using the MISP server.
fields.name: api_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Add Event
operations.description: Creates an event and adds the new event in MISP based on the event information and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event Information
parameters.description:
Brief description of the malware or event you are creating, including the internal reference for the event.
You can add a detailed description of the event by adding attributes to the event after the event is created.
parameters.name: event_info
parameters.tooltip: Specify brief description for the event

parameters.title: Date
parameters.name: date
parameters.description: (Optional) Date on which you want to create the event in MISP. The date must be in the yyyy/mm/dd format.
parameters.tooltip: Date should be year, month and day format

parameters.title: Distribution
parameters.description:
(Optional) Setting that controls on who can view this event once it is published and eventually when it gets pulled. Apart from being able to set which users on this server are allowed to see the event, this also controls whether or not the event will be synchronized to other servers.
You can choose between Your organization only, This community only, Connected communities, or All communities.
parameters.name: distribution

parameters.title: Threat Level
parameters.description:
(Optional) Indicates the risk level of the event.
You can categorize events into different threat categories, which are Low, Medium, or High. You can also alternatively leave this field as Undefined.
parameters.name: threat_level

parameters.title: Analysis Status
parameters.description:
(Optional) Indicates the current stage of analysis of the event.
You can choose between Initial, Ongoing, or Completed.
parameters.name: analysis

parameters.title: Published
parameters.description: Select this checkbox to publish the event in MISP.
parameters.name: published
parameters.tooltip: Check to publish the event in MISP

operations.title: Get Event
operations.description: Retrieves information about an event from MISP based on the event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the event whose information you want to retrieve from MISP.
parameters.name: event_id

operations.title: Add Attributes to Event
operations.description: Adds specified attributes to an existing MISP event based on the event ID, attribute type and value, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the MISP event to which you want to add attributes.
parameters.name: event_id

parameters.title: Category
parameters.description: Category of the attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP. You can choose from options such as Internal reference, Network activity, Financial fraud, etc.
parameters.name: category

parameters.title: Attribute Type
parameters.description: Type of attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP.
parameters.name: type

parameters.title: Attribute Value
parameters.description: Value of the attribute that you want to add to the specific event in MISP.
parameters.name: value
parameters.tooltip: Attribute value should be IP address, Port no, Email address, URL etc.

parameters.title: Attribute Distribution
parameters.description:
(Optional)Setting controls on who can view this attribute once it is published. By default, "Inherit Event" is set, which means that this field inherits the distribution that is set on its parent event.
You can choose between Your organization only, This community only, Connected communities, or All communities or Inherit Event.
parameters.name: distribution

parameters.title: Use Attribute as an IDS Signature
parameters.description: Select this checkbox if you want to add attributes for Intrusion Detection System (IDS) and this sets the to_IDS flag to True in MISP.
parameters.name: to_ids

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.description: (Optional) Comments that you want to add for the attributes. Comments are used for informational purposes only and not for correlations.
parameters.name: comment

operations.title: Delete Event
operations.description: Deletes an event from MISP based on the event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the event that you want to delete from MISP.
parameters.name: event_id

operations.title: Delete Attribute from Event
operations.description: Deletes an attribute from a MISP event based on the attribute ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Attribute ID
parameters.description: ID of the attribute that you want to delete from MISP.
parameters.name: attribute_id

operations.title: Run Search
operations.description: Searches for events or attributes in MISP based on the input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Controller
parameters.description: Specifies whether you want to search for Attributes or Events in MISP.
parameters.name: controller

parameters.title: Search Type
parameters.name: search_type
parameters.tooltip: Select between basic (few parameters) and advanced search (JSON based parameters)
parameters.description: Select between basic (few parameters) and advanced search (JSON based parameters)

Basic.title: Limit
Basic.name: limit
Basic.description: Limit the number of records to fetch
Basic.tooltip: Limit the number of records to fetch

Basic.title: Search From
Basic.description: Search for events after this date.
Basic.name: searchDatefrom

Basic.title: Search Until
Basic.description: Search for events until this date.
Basic.name: searchDateuntil

operations.title: Add Tag
operations.description: Adds a tag in MISP based on the tag name and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Tag Name
parameters.description: Name of the tag you want to create tag in MISP.
parameters.name: name

parameters.title: Exportable
parameters.description: Select this checkbox if you want to create an exportable tag in MISP.
parameters.name: exportable
parameters.tooltip: Check for the exportable tag in MISP

parameters.title: Hide Tag
parameters.description: Select this checkbox if you want to hide the created tag in MISP.
parameters.name: hide_tag
parameters.tooltip: Check to hide the tag in MISP

parameters.title: Organisation ID
parameters.description: ID of the organization that you want to add to the tag that you are creating in MISP.
parameters.name: org_id

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.description: ID of the user that you want to add to the tag that you are creating in MISP.
parameters.name: user_id

operations.title: List All Tags
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all existing tags from MISP.

operations.title: Add Tag to Event
operations.description: Adds a tag to an existing event in MISP based on the tag and event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the MISP event to which you want to add the specified tag.
parameters.name: event_id

parameters.title: Tag
parameters.description: Tag that you want to add to the specified event in MISP.
parameters.name: tag
parameters.tooltip: Tag should be tag ID or Name

operations.title: Remove Tag from Event
operations.description: Deletes the specified tag from an existing event in MISP based on the tag and event ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the MISP event from which you want to remove the specified tag.
parameters.name: event_id

parameters.title: Tag
parameters.description: Tag that you want to remove from the specified event in MISP.
parameters.name: tag
parameters.tooltip: Tag should be tag ID or Name

operations.title: Get Attribute Type
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all existing specific attribute type.
